column5: I might make a move to Nipigon once I leave this lair of muck and spruce.  Thanks Dan, great show

Dan thanks for posting the link to Al's slide show. You guys really have a beautiful area up there.  Al- You really did an excellent job of documenting your fishing and the photography is excellent. Thanks for joining and enjoy your stay!
Great pictures there.  What kind camera did you use?

The camera is a Canon S400 but I bought the underwater case for it. All the buttons and camera features work underwater to a depth of 130 ft. If I'm down that deep, I'm not coming back. The camera and case float so no worries dropping it overboard. I can use it in the rain, snow or sand without worry. Just rinse the case under water. I have used it diving on reefs in the ocean and it is great. I think I have attached a photo of me in Cuba feeding the fish. My next camera will have more megapixles but a waterproof case is a must for me. Alan

.....Welcome aboard Alan. Being a life long Brookie man I can sure appreciate the beauty of those photos. Also having been up that way fishing last September with Dan it just fuels my desire to get back as soon as possible.    Perhaps I'll be fortunate enough to meet you on my next trip.

Thanks Spiel: About a week or so before you came up here, Dan mentioned around the camp fire and a few pops he had someone traveling north to fish. Maybe someday we'll hit the same fish'n hole for those famed brookies.

....Well I can tell you this Alan, as a life long fly fisherman I won't travel up that way again without my fly rod. The days I spent there I definitely wish I had brought one along and your pictures certainly show me I should have. Hopefully we can toss some big Brookie flies together some day.  Cheers and Merry Christmas.
Thanks Dan, for posting the link. Welcome Al! Very enjoyable slideshow indeed!

A local Brook Trout fishing friend of mine, Al Muir,  has put together this slide show featuring our local Brook Trout fishing. The photography is incredible, as is the entire show. So, if you like Brook Trout in their prime colors, fantastic scenery and photography, sit back and enjoy.  http://photoshare.shaw.ca/gallery/amuir/

Thanks DanC,  Like I really needed that now!  You are gonna make the winter a longggg snap now bud.  The kewlest part about that slide show? I can relate to each and every photo. Thanks for that DanC.
Those are some really awesome colors, and great shots too.
thanks Dan for sharing that  - i just love those red halos around the blue spots such special fish they are

Merry Christmas to the OFC Community. I'm Al (Guidofisherman) and thanks to Dan, a local fishing friend, I have joined when Dan asked to post my slideshow about the Brook Trout. I'm not sure if it is a passion or a sickness, but I love fishing for them. Alan
Great Photos of some nice fish.  Any idea where he got the hat with H2SO4 on it. Kind of cool if it means what I think it means.  Thanks for sharing...

Well thanks for the permission to post the slide show Al, and welcome aboard. There's a few Thunder Bay guys on here. One more won't hurt. In fact, with you on board now, that's pretty much all, of us.  Seriously Al, OFC is a great place to belong to if you're into fishing. You'll like it here. Don't be a stranger. I'll be in touch soon.

Welcome to the board Al. I am sure you will enjoy it here. I have admired your web site, alot of useful information on there in relation to Brookie habitat and so forth.  Have you had much oportunity to fish in Superior for the Coasters?  And you are right, it is a sickness, the only cure is to fish more often.
Nice very very Nice!!!!!!!
Dan thanks for sharing once again spectacular pics and colors  Welcome Alan,you will enjoy this place

WOW simply amazing shots! Colors are truly awesome! The underwater shots are incredible! Welcome aboard Al, well done  Dan your report with Spiel & TEP w/pics were one of my favorite post this past year, Al and yourself are truly talented when it come to your photo's.  Thanks  Whopper

All I can say is wow!! That's some amazing brookies...I can't believe that I have drove by that river on several occasions visiting my fiancee's family and never wet a line.   Maybe next time....  Welcome aboard AL and thanks for sharing.....you certainly brought back alot of memories of fishing for those gems in  Labrador and Newfoundland. Thanks  Jason
Thanks AL, a wonderful way to start my day.  Awesome pictures!! Beautiful fish.  Thanks for posting Dan. Stick around Al, I think you'll like it here.
WOW!!!    Thanks for sharing. Make me miss my days up at L.U.
Amazing colours!  Beautiful fish. Thanks!
This was an amazing slide show!!!!!!  Thanks so much for sharing....I was definately daydreaming while watching it....cant wait til spring!!!
Thanks for posting Dan, great slide show. Ive made a few myself, but not as nice as that one. Boy those are some nice Specks.
EXCELLENT!!!!!  Welcome to the board as well AL!
Great slideshow!  Welcome to the board, Al, heck of an intro...  Mike

You are an evil,evil,evil man !! We have some speck creeks that we fish every june 1st and you just made me wish it was June !!!!!! Arghhh .The most beautiful looking fish as far as i am concerned and thank you for the show it was incredible .
Wow! Beautiful Pictures
wow,great pics and amazing brookies,thier colour is so nice,  i wish i could fish for them someday,and welcome aboard al, thats a cool way to say hello.cheers and merry xmas

I've been a member for less than a day and have enjoyed wandering around the forum and rest of the site. Impressive! To Nemo, yes the chemical signature on my fishing hat is: "H2SO4" which stands for Sulphuric Acid. I got the hat from a friend of mine who works at a local mill that uses it. I'm happy other fishermen appreciate the Brook Trout Slideshow. Al (Guidofisherman)
Very, Very nice pics,  WOW  That's one heck of an intro....Welcome Alan.
That was awesome!  Thank you
